intro: Stuckenia pectinata var. interrupta, commonly known as the interrupted pondweed, is a aquatic plant native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, ribbon-like leaves that are often interrupted or notched along their edges. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its flowers are small and greenish, often occurring in clusters at the base of the stems. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
